intro: Comandra cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf comandra, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Comandra cuneifolia is adapted to withstand drought and has a deep root system for water retention.
